summary: David Christensen is a former Air Force Security Service member who claimed to have intercepted a message related to the Kennedy assassination before it occurred. He contacted authorities with this information, leading to inquiries from both the FBI and the House Select Committee on Assassinations. The NSA forwarded Christensen's correspondence to the FBI, noting that he had a history of personal problems and safety concerns. The House Select Committee on Assassinations interviewed Sgt. Nicholas B. Stevenson regarding Christensen's allegations, specifically focusing on Stevenson's recollections of events at USA-55, Kirknewton, Scotland.
significance: David Christensen's significance in the JFK assassination context lies in his claim of intercepting a message related to the event prior to its occurrence. This claim prompted investigations and interviews, making him a figure of interest in the broader investigation of the assassination, although the documents also suggest potential credibility issues due to his personal history.
